Introduction

Welcome to the ScreenKit Documentation! Here you can find all you need to know about ScreenKit and how to use it. First of all, ScreenKit is a development tool built by alombi that let the developer create some nice and Apple-like HTML pages super-quickly, like Welcome pages or Documentations theirselves.


How to implement

Once you have created your own page with ScreenKit, you'll have to export it. When you export a project, the HTML and CSS code is copied in your clipboard. All you have to do is:

  • Open your shortcut and find the place where you want to place the HTML page
  • Add a "Text" action and paste the code
  • Add a "Set Name" action and put .html as extension (Example.html)
  • Add a "Quick Look" action.
  • Done!



How to implement the new Install Update screen

With the 1.2 update, the Install Update screen has been added to ScreenKit. This screen lets the developer show the user a wonderful and fresh update prompt.
Due to Shortcuts app limitations, this screen must be implemented in a different way:

  • Open your shortcut and find the place where you want to place the HTML page
  • Add a "Text" action and paste the code
  • Add a "Encode with base64" action and put the magic variable "Text" as argument
  • Add an "URL" action, containing data:text/html;base64, and the magic variable "Base64 Encoded
  • Add an "Open URL" action
  • Done!



How to implement the What's New Screen on iOS 14

With the iOS 14 release, the old method isn't working anymore. Implementing What's New Screens is still possible of course, but you'll need some extra steps.

  • First of all, create a project and export it
  • Open your shortcut and find the place where you want to place the HTML page
  • Add a "Text" action and paste the code
  • Add an "URL" action containing data:text/html, and the magic variable Text
  • Add a "Get contents of web page at URL" action where URL is the magic variable of the URL that you have just declared
  • Add a "Text" action
  • Copy this code Copy
  • Paste the code you copied in the Text action
  • The body tag is empty, put there the Contents of Url magic variable from the action above
  • Add a "Set Name" action and put .html as extension (Example.html)
  • Add a "Quick Look" action.
